job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Top research university with great core facility resources. Great benefits including health and dental insurance, matching 401K, tuition benefits for yourself and family.
cons: Research employment depends on funding which is tenuous.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great community and very interested students. Helpful Colleagues who are willing to share ideas with you.
cons: No cons so far, maybe that the shift is around 3 hours per week but you can definitely sign up for more if you'd like.(e.g. office hours, grading etc.)

job_title: in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- nice work environment and helpful colleagues
- clearly defined job scope and responsibilities
- management/team leader knows clearly which direction the team should go
cons: - workload is uncertain; sometimes you have plenty of idle time but sometimes you just go crazy.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in University City, St. Louis, MO
pros: WashU does not have a large number of students, so teaching duty is not heavier compared to public schools
cons: Depending on the classes that you TA for, the workload can be a lot. For instance, you may have to read and grade 100 essays.

job_title: in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Wash. U community is very friendly and driven.  St. Louis is also a pretty neat city with interesting things to do, if you look around.
cons: The midwest is not exactly the most exciting place.

job_title: Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The overall atmosphere is very friendly, lab mentors are nice, you get to use your creativity. Projects given are interesting.
cons: Holiday is kind of short. Salary is not that high. But overall it's just a transition position for college graduates. So not too bad.

review_title: Great place to do your education, research, and work!
job_title: Research Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great place to do your education, research, and work! The school is very strong at medical, biomechanics, engineering, etc. Plus St Louis is a nice town in the midwest.
cons: kinda small school, but not really any problem

review_title: Good school for biomedical graduate study
job_title: Graduate Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Vigorous academic program, good reputation, close collaboration with BJC hospital and good clinical access. Excellent health insurance and maternal leave policies for students.
cons: Not enough job opportunities, lack of alternative career training, midwest not a great place for networking into industry

job_title: Senior Scientist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Great benefit,
Great work atmosphere.
Academically and intellectually rich place to work at.
cons:
- Poor salary.
- A training that could be improved more through active collaboration with industies and oethr institutions.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Depending on the Professor, there is a lot of exciting work to be done, even for undergraduate researchers.
cons: You really get out what you put in, so if you don't have a highly specific project it is easy to get nothing out of your experience.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Diversity of staff and faculty, Food choices at the campus cafeteria, Pay and benefits are excellent
cons: Standard office drudgery, Some conflicts among the staff

review_title: Not for a faint of heart
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: World-class research and great learning experience. Good for your CV as it is ranked number 1 in Bioinformatics research.
cons: No work life balance. Supervisors nag you constantly for results and outcomes. Very tough job though.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Scholar in Saint Louis, MO
pros: They obviously have a ton of resources which can make like very easy. My mentor is fantastic and supportive.
cons: Not everyone is working with someone as supportive as my mentor. There can be a bit of competition depending what department you're in.

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Phoenix, AZ
pros: I'd like to develop my carrier regarding my future job in united state
cons: As foreigner, I might sometimes have a disadvantage in work field.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst/PPMO in Hazelwood, MO
pros: Very decent place to work.  There are opportunities in IT to grow your career.
cons: Went from a decentralized IT to centralized, but many of the departments are not buying into the centralization and it makes very difficult to perform certain duties.

job_title: Clinical Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
22 rolling vacation days
6 health plans to choose from
sick day accrual
can have casual atmosphere
Feel good about helping people
cons:
not a cohesive whole, university run as groups of specialties, areas of study
HR support is disjointed
Managers have funding and may not also have management skills

review_title: You will work among some of the best in the industry
job_title: Assistant Director in Saint Louis, MO
pros: You can feel that the work you are doing is making an impact on the students and people you impact.
cons: Turnover is often, so you feel replaceable.

job_title: Masters' Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I was a Master's student at WashU, graduating in May 2020. I really liked the variety of courses available, including an in-depth background in ML.
cons: I wish there was more distinction between MS thesis and MS project guidelines on the webpage.

job_title: Associate Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: excellent resources, excellent faculty and a well run university
cons: high pressure, very little mentorship and low salaries

review_title: Very good place to work and study as a graduate student
job_title: PhD Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Amazing group of people dedicated towards research
Top notch resources available
Highly entrepreneurship
cons: Region does not do justice to skill available around

review_title: Very good place to work and study as a graduate student
job_title: PhD Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Amazing group of people dedicated towards research
Top notch resources available
Highly entrepreneurship
cons: Region does not do justice to skill available around

review_title: Very good for the most part
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Standard of research is world-class; great learning environment without a short supply of mentors.
cons: Very productivity driven; too fast-paced! Bottom-line is all that matters!

review_title: Great school to study and work
job_title: Graduate Student in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Friendly people to work with. Provides employees with great benefit package for kids' education, one of the top research universities.
cons: Location is something to consider. It is far away from other major cities. Safety is another important issue to consider.

job_title: Communications in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great experience and co-workers were great. Hours were flexible.
cons: Historically WASHU is not known for their diversification with regards to their employees. Wages are low.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: health insurance, ample paid vacation and sick time
cons: paid maternity leave for staff would be nice

review_title: Vascular Surgery Dept. — Worst Place. Hate it here
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Washu gives employees free tuition for my kids. Other depts are way better.
cons: Vascular surgery is the worst place to work. I go home crying everyday and have broken out in hives from it. People are cliquish. I have seen people be called cuss words in emails. My boss won’t even talk to me. I have worked hard and don’t expect a raise. I don’t want to feel abused.

review_title: Good to work at Wash U
job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Work with intelligent people, strong sense of community and fellowship, prestige. Great benefits and affordable insurance.
cons: You're expected to do much more than your hired for. Once you figure out the expectations set upon you, it's OK.

job_title: Senior Research Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: vacation time is fairly generous, and, after introductory period (2 years), employer contribution to retirement is nice
cons: As in academic research everywhere, the job is demanding.  If you want set hours and a regular schedule, this is not for you.

job_title: Professional Rater II in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Dr. Luby is a fantastic boss.
Great benefits.
This company cares about work/life balance.
So fulfilling to be a part of groundbreaking research!
cons: Nothing really. Parking is a pain, but is that really worthy of a con?

job_title: in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The vacation, medical and retirement benefits.
cons: Theyy are not pro-active in iformation technology, even though the responsibility of the department was to teach it.

review_title: I have been a research assistant for WashU Medical School for over a year.
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great mentors in clinical research. A great place to learn.
cons: The compensation is not much.

job_title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Benefits are amazing 
great source of education in general and clinical research in particular
variety of principle Investiators
cons:
Low salary
years to get a promotion
Raises are maxed out at 2%
Parking is insanely expensive
location is not the best area in St. Louis

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great benefits and strong research community. Collaborative environment and people are nice even if they are ambitious. Very strong medical school with talented students.
cons: Quite low salaries for postdocs.

review_title: Good for entry developers, but not recommended for seniors
job_title: Programmer II in Saint Louis, MO

Great benefits:
- 22 Paid Vacation Days / year
- 12 Sick Leave / year
- 7% of match for 403b
- College Tuition Match / Waiver of kids after working 7+ yrs
cons:
No bonus
Promotion ladder very unclear

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Had great experience working with incredible people. The collaboration between the engineering school and the medical school, makes it really easy to collaborate across disciplines. All in all, great research environment.
cons: The graduate stipend was on the low side.

review_title: very nice place to work in.
job_title: Scientist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
nice benefit
reasonable pressure
friendly
pleasant
good management
nice employees
cons:
location
salary not that great
not much that I can think of

review_title: Great Institution, PI's are hit or miss
job_title: Research Technician II in Saint Louis, MO

cons: Not much vertical movement, Experience is totally dependent on PI, Limited options without doctorate

review_title: In general a nice graduate school
job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Teaching quality is satisfying. Medical school is very strong. Many scholarship opportunities...
cons:
Location. Not too many companies around and the local internship opportunity is limited.
Engineering school is weak. I feel it is on a downward trend.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It is nice place. People are friendly and the students are very smart so you feel comfortable.
cons: It is relatively a small university, so if you want to change what you do, you may not be able to find it.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Trainee in Milpitas, CA
pros: The University is conveniently located in the Central West End part of town. The faculty are world renowned.
cons: The city is not safe.

job_title: Physician Assistant in Chesterfield, MO
pros: The communication between management and employees is horrible. They will lie to your face
cons: They have a high turnover rate!!

review_title: Excellent place to develop research and teaching skills
job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It's a wonderfully supportive atmosphere for research.  Library services are excellent.
cons: It can be difficult to meet people because research expectations are so high, most faculty are overwhelmed with work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Working as a student library assistant gives you some amount of lull time to complete assignments for class, especially if you have evening or weekend hours.
cons: Starting pay is at minimum wage with little increase over time

job_title: Alumni and Development Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The best part of working for Alumni and Development was the range in day to day tasks. It was always something new.
cons: The office culture is older, and it is very serious.

review_title: How can you climb a one-rung ladder?
job_title: Secretary in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Vacation and benefits packages are nice.
cons: There is no room for advancement.  The pay is sub-par and they pile on more and more work without proper compensation.  However, some employees seem to be the "favorites" and get praised and rewarded for doing the bare minimum.

job_title: Clinical Recruiter in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Excellent benefit package!  It's a fast paced environment and has many locations throughout St. Louis metro areas.
cons: If you work downtown, parking is a bit crowded.  You may want to take advantage of their free Metropass.

job_title: Project Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- Great work atmosphere, 
- Opportunity to grow 
- Great benefits.
cons:
- The pay you receive for the work that you do is just not fair compensation.
- Parking is a nightmare and is way too expensive for employees.

review_title: Greate place to work as a postdoc, but do research about the individual PI
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Big academic community especially for life sciences. Good funding and collaboration opportunities.
cons: Postdoc life is not that exciting here. Most of the postdocs find it tough.

review_title: Good place to work if you dont mind working 50-60hrs/week and weekends
job_title: Instructor In Medicine in Saint Louis, MO
pros: great benefits, secure if you have research grant funding
cons: long hours, weekends, even if they say 40hr workweeks.  no work-life balance. need to get your own research grant funding

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I thought the research I was doing was quite interesting but sometimes tedious. Very Flexible hours
cons: The pay was very bad ($10 an hour) especially when you realize the school has a 9 billion dollar endowment

review_title: Overall, it is a good community.
job_title: Research Scientist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: People here are very nice. and the working enviroment is not stressful. The hours are pretty flexible. You will have a lot of resources to learn and improve yourself
cons: The promotion may be slow.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Knowledge of senior employees. Access to physicians
cons: Pay. Parking. Hours worked as salaried employee. Absolutely no advancement anywhere no matter what your education and annual reviews which are useless.

review_title: A top notch program in transition.

Small Class Sizes

CEL

review_title: Does nothing for the in house talent growth

review_title: Very respectable institution, and great benefits.

review_title: Great place to work with excellent benefits, great advancement and opportunities to grow!

job_title: in Saint Louis, MO

job_title: Research Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
